metadata.title: CVE-2021-4002 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high
metadata.description: A memory leak flaw in the Linux kernel's hugetlbfs memory usage was foundin the way the user maps some regions of memory twice using shmget() whichare aligned to PUD alignment with the fault of some of the memory pages. Alocal user could use this flaw to get unauthorized access to some data.
